IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: A NON-PROFIT SENIOR LIVING COMMUNITY DEDICATED TO PROVIDING QUALITY HOUSING, REHABILITATIVE SERVICES AND LONG-TERM NURSING CARE REFLECTING CHRISTIAN COMPASSION FOR EVERYONE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: A NON-PROFIT SENIOR LIVING COMMUNITY DEDICATED TO PROVIDING QUALITY HOUSING, REHABILITATIVE SERVICES AND LONG-TERM NURSING CARE REFLECTING CHRISTIAN COMPASSION FOR EVERYONE.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDED NURSING CARE SERVICES FOR 46,066 PATIENT DAYS OF NURSING FACILITY CARE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION PAYS DUES TO LEADINGAGE KENTUCKY OF WHICH $245 IS RELATED TO LOBBYING PURPOSES.

THE CORPORATION IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL INCOME TAXES AS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION AS DESCRIBED UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). THE CORPORATION FILES AN INFORMATIONAL TAX RETURN WITH THE U.S. FEDERAL JURISDICTION AND WITH THE KENTUCKY OFFICE OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL. HOWEVER, INCOME FROM CERTAIN ACTIVITIES NOT DIRECTLY RELATED TO THE CORPORATION'S TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE MAY BE SUBJECT TO TAXATION AS UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. MANAGEMENT DOES NOT BELIEVE THAT THE CORPORATION HAS UNREALTED BUSINESS INCOME FOR THE YEARS ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2018 AND 2017. AS OF SEPTEMBER 30, 2018 AND 2017, THE CORPORATION DID NOT HAVE ANY ACCRUED INTEREST OR PENALTIES RELATED TO INCOME TAX LIABILITIES, AND NO INTEREST OR PENALTIES HAVE BEEN CHARGED TO OPERATIONS FOR THE YEARS THEN ENDED.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: COUNTY OF CLARK COUNTY KY HEALTH FACILITIES REVENUE BONDS SERIES A & B

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MINUTES OF THE COMMITTEES ARE NOT MAINTAINED, BUT ALL COMMITTEES REPORT AT THE BOARD MEETINGS AND ACTION IS REFLECTED IN BOARD MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AFTER THE 990S ARE PREPARED BY THE DESIGNATED ACCOUNTING FIRM, THE 990S ARE SUBMITTED TO MEMBERS OF THE BOARD FOR COMMENTS. ALSO, YEAR-END FINANCIALS AND DATA PREPARED FOR 990S ARE PRESENTED BY THE AUDITOR TO THE BOARD-APPOINTED FINANCE COMMITTEE. THE 990S ARE DESIGNATED FOR APPROVAL TO THE GOVERNING BODY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ADMINISTRATOR IS RESPONSIBLE TO MAKE DETERMINATIONS ON CONFLICTS OF INTEREST IN REGARDS TO EMPLOYEES. THE BOARD REVIEWS ALL MAJOR CONTRACTS BEFORE THEY ARE ENTERED INTO TO DETERMINE IF A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST MAY EXIST. IF A CONTRACT IS ENTERED INTO WITH A BOARD MEMBER OR HIS/HER FIRM THE BOARD MEMBER IS REQUIRED TO SUBMIT HIS/HER RESIGNATION TO THE BOARD. HOWEVER, THE BOARD MAY VOTE TO REJECT THE RESIGNATION IF THEY DO NOT FEEL A CONFLICT EXISTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION USES THE FOLLOWING PROCESS TO DETERMINE COMPENSATION FOR ITS TOP MANAGEMENT: A. REVIEW AND APPROVAL BY GOVERNING BODY, PROVIDED THAT A PERSON WHO HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH RESPECTS TO COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENT AT ISSUE ARE NOT INVOLVED IN THE REVIEW AND APPROVAL.; B. USE COMPARABLE COMPENSATION DATA; AND C. DOCUMENTATION OF THE WHOLE PROCESS. THE BOARD'S COMPENSATION COMMITTEE RECEIVES COMPENSATION DATA EACH YEAR FROM VARIOUS SOURCES FOR OTHER TOP MANAGEMENT POSITIONS, INCLUDING ASSOCIATIONS TO WHICH WE BELONG. THIS DATA PROVIDES INDUSTRY SPECIFIC INFORMATION FROM COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS IN ORDER FOR US TO REMAIN COMPETITIVE AND ASSURE THAT OUR COMPENSATION IS IN LINE. THE PERFORMANCE OF THE INDIVIDUAL IS A MAJOR FACTOR IN THE DECISIONS MADE BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE DOCUMENTATION REVIEWED BY THE COMMITTEE IS RETAINED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PUBLIC INSPECTION IS MADE AVAILABLE BY (A) CONTACTING THE OFFICE OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS, (B) SUBMISSION OF WRITTEN REQUEST TO THE OFFICE OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OR (C) MAY BE PUBLISHED AND MADE AVAILABLE ONLINE AT WWW.GUIDESTAR.COM.
THE FINANCIAL AUDIT REPORT IS APPROVED BY MANAGEMENT AND PRESENTED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE BY THE AUDITORS.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: HOUSING FOR THE ELDERLY AND MANAGEMENT & ADMINISTRATIVE OVERSIGHT

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: SAYRE CHRISTIAN VILLAGE APTS II INC
